en: Either the well was very deep, or she fell very slowly, for she had plenty of time as she went down to look about her and to wonder what was going to happen next. First, she tried to look down and make out what she was coming to, but it was too dark to see anything; then she looked at the sides of the well, and noticed that they were filled with cupboards and book-shelves; here and there she saw maps and pictures hung upon pegs. She took down a jar from one of the shelves as she passed; it was labelled “ORANGE MARMALADE”, but to her great disappointment it was empty: she did not like to drop the jar for fear of killing somebody underneath, so managed to put it into one of the cupboards as she fell past it.

es: O el pozo era en verdad profundo, o ella caía muy despacio, porque Alicia, mientras descendía, tuvo tiempo sobrado para mirar a su alrededor y para preguntarse qué iba a suceder después. Después miró hacia las paredes del pozo y observó que estaban cubiertas de armarios y estantes para libros: aquí y allá vio mapas y cuadros, colgados de clavos. Cogió, a su paso, un jarro de los estantes. Llevaba una etiqueta que decía: MERMELADA DE NARANJA, pero vio, con desencanto, que estaba vacío. tr_translation: She seemed to hear the Queen's grating voice condemning her poor guests to death; once again, dishes and plates flew around as the baby pig sneezed in the Duchess's lap; once again, the Gryphon roared, the Lizard scratched its pencil on the slate; the silenced guinea pigs made deep sounds; and the distant sobs of the poor Mock Turtle mingled with these. While sitting with her eyes closed like that, she truly thought she was in Wonderland; but she knew that if she opened her eyes, everything would take on its dull color: the grass would rustle in the wind, the pond would ripple in response to the swaying reeds; instead of the clinking of tea cups, the sound of sheep bells would be heard, instead of the Queen's screams, the shepherd's calls would be heard; the piglet's sneeze, the Dragon's roar, in short, all those strange sounds would be replaced (she knew) by the continuous noise and clatter of the working farm! The distant mooing of cows would replace the Mock Turtle's sobs...

es_translation: Alice's sister was sitting there, with her eyes closed, and she almost believed she was also in Wonderland. But she knew that just by opening her eyes again, she would find herself suddenly in the boring reality. The grass would only be stirred by the wind, and the splashing of the pond would be due to the trembling of the reeds growing in it. The clinking of the tea cups would turn into the ringing of cowbells, and the piercing voice of the Queen into the shouts of a shepherd. And the baby's sneezes, the Gryphon's squawks, and all the other mysterious noises would (she knew) turn into the confused murmur coming from a nearby farm, while the distant bleating of the flocks would replace the sobs of the Mock Turtle.
